attributes.action: Bring back national service
attributes.background: So the nation is ready for an unexpected attack or overseas war, also it would help to mold younger people to be more patriotic and proud of our great nation, it also teaches great life skills such as respect, team work, and patriotism and how to help ones self,
attributes.additional_details:
The older generation always say it should be brought back as it didn't do them any harm, 

also it would help against crime that the youth of today get involved in also the new threat of radicalization in the unhappy or troubled members of younger society the ones who think they are useless and have no calling in life, at least national service would unstil a sense of purpose,

attributes.action: Care homes all fitted with cameras
attributes.background: If pubs need cameras to prevent violence, then why haven't care homes got them? Nothing to hide? Then fit cameras in all care homes now, ideally connected to wifi so that relatives can look in at any time. Obviously beds and bathrooms need to be exempt but accessible by audio.
attributes.additional_details:
A camera with sound in every home where carers visit would also be a good idea, linked via Wi - Fi to anyone requiring access. Nothing to hide? Then nothing to worry about. 
 With an average of £1000 a week the cameras will not event make a dent in profits. 
Sign up now...You may be the next one to be treated badly in care.

attributes.action: Review the way the Department of Work and Pensions treats mentally ill claimants
attributes.background: I am doing this on behalf of a friend who has suffered with long term depression and has been treated appallingly by the DWP. I am concerned that this is not a one-off case and that there are a lot of vulnerable people who are being treated in such an irresponsible and dangerous manner.

attributes.action: Remove the NHS from political control. HM Government to set NHS budgets only.
attributes.background: The NHS should be run by a board of governors who are accountable to Parliament, like the BBC, with sensible targets, acceptable staffing levels and long-term plans. Politicians could then honestly debate the real issue, FUNDING, allowing a clear choice between parties which would interest voters.
attributes.additional_details: Constant reorganisation by politicians has damaged the NHS: it is divisive and saps energy, focus and productivity; there has been little time for benefits to show. Some change has been driven by political ideology from both sides without much clinical benefit. Governments only look 5 years ahead, until the next election. A quick fix for 5 years is no good. An independent but accountable, properly managed NHS would use research and sound experience to make plans for us all for the long term.

attributes.action: Completely Scrap Stamp Duty, we pay enough taxes!
attributes.background: Stamp Duty should be scraped, we pay enough already in taxes and scraping Stamp Duty will help people to afford to buy a property

attributes.action: Ban Air Guns
attributes.background: After a ricochet I was shot in the eye with an air pistol over 50 years ago and still being treated for the after effects, it has left me with partial sight that causes problems to this day.

attributes.action: Make it Illegal to prescribe paracetamol
attributes.background: In 2015 over 22 million prescriptions for paracetamol were written at a cost to tax payers of over £80 million pounds – an average cost of £3.67 per prescription.....paracetamol can be purchased for 19p!!!!!

attributes.action: Scrap the compulsory roll out of Smart Meters by energy companies
attributes.background: Smart meters said to give total control of energy use & reduce bills is a ruse to introduce ‘time of day’ pricing tariffs. Designated peak times will impact low income, pensioners and increase bills. Energy companies will manipulate behaviour to their advantage with smart meters to spy on us.
attributes.additional_details:
UK Gov has done little to stop consumer exploitation. Smart meters infringe privacy & give risk of data security. Hackers could hijack the grid & cut off your supply.  Many EU countries reject smart meters. We don't need to comply with EU Directives for compulsory smart meters.   

UK Gov must scrap compulsory roll out – it’s costly, unlikely to change consumption habits, adversely affect low income/pensioners, is invasive & a security risk, restricting freedom to use energy when you need to.

attributes.action: Cap private renting to affordable prices for working families
attributes.background: Private renting in the UK is at an all time high increased far more than wages and families are struggling to make ends meet because of over priced private properties to rent. The government should set out new legislation for landlords to abide by.

attributes.action: Rejecting Brexit - find a better alternative to leaving the EU.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to refrain from invoking Article 50. Instead we call upon you to work with the other 27 EU members to find a solution to the issues associated with the free movement of people throughout the EU and, if necessary, to subsequently hold a second EU referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
A key issue for many who voted to leave the EU is unlimited migration of EU citizens into the UK. The issue of migration within the EU impacts countries beyond the UK and must be addressed by the EU as a whole to prevent further countries voting to leave.

If the UK were to leave the EU around half the UK population would still be left dissatisfied. By contrast, we believe that the UK remaining in a reformed EU could satisfy a significantly larger majority of the UK population.

attributes.action: Lets Join The Nordic Alliance. Post Brexit
attributes.background: Iceland wants the UK to join Nordic alliance, and I do too! Not only is the Nordic alliance built from some of the most amazing coolest countries on the planet, we are also very closely linked in our customs and our history.
attributes.additional_details:
Iceland wants the UK to join Nordic alliance, and I do too! Not only is the Nordic alliance built from some of the most amazing coolest countries on the planet, we are also very closely linked in our customs and our history.

"When Britain leaves the EU, we will see a triangle that covers a large part of the globe: Greenland, Iceland, the Faroe Islands, Norway - and now the United Kingdom,” said Iceland’s President Olafur Ragnar Grimsson

attributes.action: Make MP's like us: 93% state school; 50% women; 100% from their constituency.
attributes.background: The country is economically and politically divided. MP's are bewildered by those outside London because they are so different from them. Let's break the domination of private school educated, London based men in our politics. Bring in quotas now for our representatives so MP's look like us.
attributes.additional_details:
50% of the population are women. Women got the vote a hundred years ago and still they are under represented and under paid in every walk of life.
7% of the population are private school educated and yet they make up to 50% of MP's in government. 
Career politicians live and work in London and do not understand the people they represent. 
These three problems can be solved by the next General Election. Let's make MP's more like us and bring in quotas for a fairer, less divided, United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Make an application for EU membership no later than 1 year after leaving the EU
attributes.background:
Many people who voted to leave the European Union in the June 2016 referendum have changed their minds and a clear message that EU reform is needed has been sent and, we hope, received. 
We wish, in the interests of unity and prosperity, to reclaim the UK's place in the EU.

attributes.action: Put a cap on homework for under 17's
attributes.background: The amount of homework is decided by the education minister, who signs acts that will never directly effect him. It has been shown by several studies that excessive amounts of homework can lead to depression, anxiety and even lower grades. I think there should be a cap on homework to prevent this.
attributes.additional_details:
My sources:
https://factualfacts.com/science-facts/too-much-homework-can-cause-stress-depression-and-lower-grades-studies-suggest/

http://www.mindmake.com/blog/too-much-homework-can-cause-stress-depression-and-lower-grades/

https://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/the-squeaky-wheel/201110/how-much-homework-is-too-much

attributes.action: Make PTSD a recognised illness for fair claim and recognition of PIP at DWP.
attributes.background: I would like the government to re-address the level of illness, disability and point scoring of PIP claims for PTSD. British people need fair claim for the illness that is debilitating and get the help in such times of need. There is apparent great need for this within the ex-services community.
attributes.additional_details: I tried claiming PIP on the encouragement of my social worker before medical discharg for PTSD. Following the interview for PIP, which was distresssing enough, I was given zero points, even though on the letter I received it stateded I obviously had some form of mental illness at this time. I could get nothing as it's not classed as a health condition or disability. I am well now but would have benefitted from the extra income, as I was unable to do many activitys of daily living due to my PTSD.

attributes.action: Make eateries develop a menu accessible and readable for all
attributes.background: After a recent meal out with people with learning disabilities I found myself wondering why, with all the focus on rights and choice there was no easy read menu. One non-verbal service user had to just eat what was chosen for him, whereas if there were menus with photos he could choose for himself.
attributes.additional_details: It would not take much for restaurants and cafes to develop a photo menu, as well as a menu in braille. There is huge focus on treating people equally in society these days, yet in so many establishments a large amount of the population are ignored. We now have wheelchair access in most places for physically disabled people so it's about time all disabled people were considered.

attributes.action: Make it law for drivers to slow down and move over when they see roadworkers
attributes.background: every year a number of recovery operators and roadside technicians and other roadworkers are killed because of people not giving enough room when we are working on motorways. when they see flashing orange beacons slow down and move over to the middle lane to give us enough room to work safely

attributes.action: A standard internet speed of 24 megabits per second (Mbps) for the UK.
attributes.background: In the 21st Century our lives are dependent on the internet; while in Dorset, Eng we have to depend on 0.64 Mbps download. This is humiliatingly far behind other nations' and insufficient to even stream a film. Therefore, we propose a minimum speed of 24 Mbps that will ensure fair speeds for the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some examples of the poor speeds from across the UK:

http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/article/38067272/autumn-statement-five-places-you-say-need-better-broadband-around-the-uk

In rural Dorset: http://www.speedtest.net/my-result/5904028990

http://www.techdigest.tv/2016/12/4g-coverage-better-in-peru-than-britain-says-damning-report-from-lord-adonis.html

http://www.telecomstechnews.com/news/2016/dec/20/uk-14-million-premises-lack-decent-broadband-connections-finds-ofcom/

attributes.action: Make it illegal for parents to stop the other parent seeing their children
attributes.background: Some parents use children as a weapon to hurt the other parent. This is wrong in many ways and needs to stop. Let's get something done about it! Make it illegal for parents to do this without a court order or police recommendation

attributes.action: Public enquiry:Investigate state of prisons. Bring British Army in to help staff
attributes.background: Prison staff are unable to cope with the safe running of our prisons. Staff and inmates safety must be priority. Promises of more staff have not been fulfilled. More training is needed for prison roles. Health and safety practice is poor. Begin a public enquiry. In the meantime; bring in our Army.
attributes.additional_details: Inmates rehabilitation is not to the standards that they could be. Inmates need guidance. The ratio of inmates per staff member is unreasonable. Thus, staff suffer and potentially risk their safety. Prison staff are over-worked and not paid enough in light of the work that they undertake. Inmates are often not in receipt of adequate care. The lack of rehabilitation of offenders affects all parts of our society. It is time to stop ignoring inmates and staff members needs.

attributes.action: Stop Corporation tax cuts and put the Money into Social Care.
attributes.background: £4.6 BILLION in corporation tax cuts is currently being planned by the Tory Party.   Yesterday, Wednesday 14th Dec, in the last Prime ministers question time of the year,  Jeremy Corbyn MP appealed for the £4.6b in corporation tax cuts be put into Social care instead to help solve this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
The Tory government has cut Social Care and the PM, cabinet, and everybody else knows the effects of these cuts.This crisis is a difficult one for many elderly people because it is also a crisis for the NHS. Those people who are in hospital cannot be discharged because there is nowhere else for them to go. The crisis affects individuals, families and The NHS. 

References
https://youtu.be/p_gl4Z-PJTk

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/m.huffpost.com/uk/entry/uk_585149c8e4b08b39538f4bf0/amp

https://www.politicshome.com/news/uk/politics/news/81735/live-prime-ministers-questions-141216

attributes.action: Increase pressure to provide vital aid and evacution to the people of Aleppo.
attributes.background: The people of East Aleppo are being slaughtered. Before our very eyes via social media, hundreds are dying from the bombardment of the city. In recent days, the situation has become even more apocalyptic - the British Government simply must do more to help these people, by providing aid and escape.

attributes.action: "Remain" should not be an option if a second referendum is agreed.
attributes.background:
Including "remain" in any second referendum on the deal achieved by the UK government would only serve to undermine the governments position and be intended to prevent the UK leaving the European Union.

MPs that wish to ignore the vote of the British people should reveal themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
All too often "I respect the outcome of the referendum to leave the European Union...but" is uttered by fervent supporters of the EU.  

It is all too often accompanied by proposals of a second referendum "on the terms" of our exit from the EU; this is designed to undermine UK government negotiations and ultimately thwart the outcome of the referendum of the 23rd June 2016.

A second referendum should only be on the terms agreed to EXIT the EU.

attributes.action: Save Our Children's Centre's and say no to closures
attributes.background: Lot's of jobs are being cut to save money. If this is done then Children's Centres will be effected.
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this petition to help try and save our centres....This is not only for the parents but also for every child and member of the community who uses these places on a day to day basis.

attributes.action: Ban Strobe Lighting at Events like concerts etc
attributes.background: In the UK 1 in 103 people suffer from a form of epilepsy. Epileptics should be able to enjoy live music, films, shows, clubs etc. I am not asking for the occasional strobe to be banned but I am asking that excessive strobe lighting be banned.

attributes.action: Reverse the Government's decision to 'ban' Lettings Agency applicant/tenant fees
attributes.background: The decision by the Government to 'ban' applicant/tenant fees is poorly conceived and of little benefit to tenants or the economy of the UK. In addition, this 'ban' goes against the very grain/ideology of a 'free market' economy.
attributes.additional_details: The announced plans to 'ban' (outright) the ability for Lettings Agencies to charge fees to applicants/tenants is based on a fundamental misunderstanding by the government as to how Lettings Agencies/Landlords are required to operate. The Government implies that tenants do not have a choice as to which property they wish to rent or which agency they wish to use, which displays an inherent lack of understanding as to how the property industry functions and what is required of it.

attributes.action: Move council tax non-payment months to Dec & Jan to help with winter fuel costs
attributes.background: On a 10 month direct debit plan, council tax isn't paid in April or May, please just change that to December and January to give everyone more money during the cold winter months to help with fuel costs and Christmas expenses.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government can make all councils do this by amending the Council Tax (Administration and Enforcement) Regulations 1992.

attributes.action: Begin phasing out the sale of new fossil-fuel powered cars by 2018
attributes.background: Although by no means the only cause of air pollution, there is an opportunity to make inroads into NOx emissions by the gradual phasing-out of fossil-fuel powered cars, commencing with banning company car fleets from purchasing anything other than fully electric vehicles by 2018.
attributes.additional_details: Then, sales of private non-electric-powered cars must be prohibited by 2025.  Obviously, this must be supported by additional scrappage schemes to help those who must buy cars to meet the additional costs of electric vehicles AND (more importantly), massively increased investment in public transport but by starting with fleets, this will mean the first phase of eliminating fossil fuel powered cars will by carried out by those best placed to absorb the costs - i.e. large businesses

attributes.action: Redirect the estate of those who die intestate from Prince Charles to the NHS.
attributes.background: Currently Prince Charles receives the estate of those dying intestate (without a will or any relevant surviving relatives) in Cornwall. This petition requests the law is changed so that money is given to the NHS rather than to the prince.

attributes.action: Make it law for companies to let applicants know if they have got a job or not.
attributes.background: When we apply for a job many of us find that we don't hear a thing back from the company concerned.  This has to stop, not only is it downright rude of a company/employer small or large to not tell people if they did not get a job.  I think it also has a negative affect on confidence.

attributes.action: Protect the NE-Derbyshire parliamentry constituency from boundary changes.
attributes.background: There has been proposed boundary changes around the UK, one including my local constituency 'North East Derbyshire', it's been proposed that the constituency be scrapped but replaced with two new ones, which obviously doesn't make sense and is completely unnecessary.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed boundary changes are in a sense 'undemocratic', local residents vote for a candidate to represent their constituency as their local MP, but changes are confusing local residents and angering some.

My source for this information is local media and other sources, I recommend googling about it, to find more information to prove this.

attributes.action: Require the Cabinet ministers to have experience relevant to their roles.
attributes.background: In most public sector jobs the relevant Cabinet minister has little/no experience actually doing any of the jobs they oversee. It would give them more credibility if they have done the jobs in the sector that they're responsible for. eg.The minister for health should have worked in healthcare.

attributes.action: Ban the use of loud fireworks in residential areas
attributes.background: Many animals find fireworks scary. It is estimated that 45 per cent of dogs and other animals in the UK show signs of fear when they hear fireworks (RSPCA). This can include toileting indoors, shaking, barking and crying. Fireworks should not be used in a residential area to avoid animal distress.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks should not be allowed in residential areas, and should only be allowed in a licensed settings on set days, not days or weeks before/after the event.

attributes.action: 1p and 2p coins should be removed from circulation (cash transactions only)
attributes.background:
We the undersigned want to see the 1p and 2p pieces removed from circulation, since they are no longer of a useful value.

Over time, due to inflation, the value of a coin decreases. The one and two penny pieces are now worth so little that we cannot buy anything useful with them.
attributes.additional_details:
It is important to clarify that this petition is not asking for ALL transactions to be rounded to the nearest 5p. This petition only applies to cash. It calls for removal of 1p and 2p coins, therefore any cash transaction would result in change given rounded to the nearest 5p.

Examples
- If I were to use cash to buy a bottle of milk costing 99p, I would receive no change, since 1p rounds down to zero.

- If I were to buy a cake costing 96p, I would receive 5p change, because 4p rounds up to 5p.

attributes.action: England : have a referendum to leave the U.k. thus leaving the EU automatically
attributes.background:
As the UK is a political entity within the EU. If England would vote to leave the U.K. Then England would automatically become its own country outside the UK and the EU. No article 50 needed. No negotiations beforehand. 

The Scottish referendum made this clear to any country that leaves the U.K.

attributes.action: Make Armistice Day 2018 a national holiday
attributes.background: As the 11th of November 2018 will be the centenary of the end of the Great War (WW1) I believe as a make of respect the whole of the UK should have a national holiday to remember the fallen.

attributes.action: Move the Ministry for Exiting the EU to Northern England
attributes.background: It is important that the ministry has a good appreciation of the needs of the economy outside the S.E. of England where a great deal of the regeneration and products produced for export come from. It would help in the building confidence in and reinforcing the Northern Powerhouse.
attributes.additional_details: The re-balancing of the economy will be an important component of restructuring the economy after Brexit, the industrial areas of the north had traditionally been part of the successful rise of Britain as a global superpower.

attributes.action: Allow the continued use of A2 motorcycle restrictor kits.
attributes.background: The plan to prohibit current use of A2 restrictor kit seems unfair to a lot of riders as this is a step up for their current A1 licence restricting the to 125cc motorcycles. The UK is one of the strictest if not the strictest when it comes to motorcycle laws,this is a step in the wrong direction.

attributes.action: Ban the use of driverless cars before it's too late.
attributes.background: They are danger to other road users. An absurd idea and will cause the death of many pedestrians that could of been avoided. If you don't want to drive then get a taxi. They are not safe for anyone other than the passenger.

attributes.action: Force the government to raise the threshold of inheritance tax to £1,000,000.
attributes.background: Current threshold for inheritance tax is £325,000. After that a 40% rate is applied.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/bulletins/housepriceindex/2015-04-14

https://www.gov.uk/inheritance-tax/overview

attributes.action: Raise the UK speed limit on Motorways and major a roads to 85
attributes.background: Will help with the flow of traffic on major A roads and motorways
attributes.additional_details: Most people already speed on motorways and major A roads and everybody know so  it so instead make it legal instead of illegal.

attributes.action: Raise the fine for using a handheld device at the wheel to £1,000.
attributes.background: The Press states that the fine for using a handheld device at the wheel will be doubled from £100 to £200.   For a car owner / driver this is ridiculously small.   I believe that the Government should raise the fine for such dangerous behaviour to at least £1,000.   Breaking this law should hurt!

attributes.action: Have older drivers be assessed free of charge once hitting a particular age.
attributes.background: Every year thousands of UK drivers are involved in a road traffic collision of some kind and unfortunately a lot are OAP's. For some older people there reaction times and awareness on the road are limited.
attributes.additional_details: A goverment funded assessment should be put into place to assess any older drivers once they hit a particular age to be passed as safe to be on UK roads. By doing this thousands of lives can be saved and while not every driver above a particular age is unsafe on the road many are also unaware of there dangerous driving style. Help save lives by supporting a goverment funded assessment to unsure everyone is safe on the road.

attributes.action: Make the use of parent and child parking spaces in car parks badge holders only!
attributes.background: When parking with young children in car parks extra door space is needed. Most car parks provide this facility but unfortunately some people don't think they need to have children in the car to use these spaces. I think the introduction of a badge system to use these spaces is needed to stop this.
attributes.additional_details: Every time I use or try to use these spaces that are provided for parents with children I see others use them with no children in the car. I think that this lack of consideration is very infuriating and every parent I have spoken to agrees. At one time or another I'm sure like me you have struggled to get your children out of a small space because maybe that last space had been taken by someone who didn't actually need it. If you agree with me please sign this petition

attributes.action: Keep present allowances for disabled and assisted accomodation tenants.
attributes.background: The present efforts by the government to attack the poorest and most vulnerable in our society must stop.I work with both the disabled and the homeless who do not have a voice. Help me and sign this petition to be their voice.
attributes.additional_details: Rental allowances from benefit are capped and often fall short of the required amount- which then has to be topped up from benefits- often leaving individuals with less than £60 a week for all their needs (food, toiletries, transport, household goods etc) This is inhuman treatment of the most vulnerable in our society who need our help and support.The allowances should be kept and increased yearly in line with the cost of living index.

attributes.action: DWP: decision to extend the waiting time for Mortgage payment to 39 weeks!
attributes.background:
If you get laid off / paid off / made redundant and have a mortgage – you have to wait 39 Weeks before the DWP will make any payment to your lender? 
This is a disgrace – It used to be 13 Weeks wait before April of this year, which was bad enough, but now 9 Months – how are people meant to survive?
attributes.additional_details:
What are the government thinking abouts? 
Do they want to make people homeless? They would then be responsible for housing them.
There is a severe lack of social housing – and this will just add to the crisis. Social housing will cost 3-4 times the amount of the mortgage!

SMI: Support for Mortgage Interest 
https://www.gov.uk/support-for-mortgage-interest/what-youll-get

attributes.action: Drug test all ministers and senior civil servants including the military
attributes.background: Rig workers are tested to avoid destroying the North Sea in fact lots of employers demand a pre employment tests. Our representatives are running the country and far too many senior politicians behave and look like they are on much more than fairy dust .We deserve the best.

attributes.action: Return Tier 1 Skilled Migrant visa for professionals of shortage occupation list
attributes.background: Currently there is a shortage occupation list which is well documented. Regardless of this shortage occupation list, the complex process for Tier 2 visa is a deterrent for companies to recruit even the perfect professional candidate from outside of the EU. UK thus loses the best to other EU nations!
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/486107/Shortage_Occupation_List_-_November_2015.pdf

attributes.action: Treat Halls of Residence as commercial premises for TV licence purposes
attributes.background: Halls of residence are little more than self catering Hotels or Hostels.  Students share "Flats" with on average 8 other students. Although they have their own room (as they do at home and don't need their own licence).Yet every student has to pay for their own licence! This is an unfair system.
attributes.additional_details: A 50 bedroom hostel would pay £145.50 for the first 15 units and £145.50 for every 5 units after that. So its total cost would be £1164.00 which divided by 50 people is only £23.28 each per year. However in a 50 room hall of residence each student has to pay £145.50 because their rooms include receiving equipment/sockets, whether they use them or not. The total cost raised for the BBC is £7275 (more if paid in installments) If students can't have free TV then at least make the system fair.

attributes.action: Restrict drivers aged 17-22 to cars limited to 40mph and 0-60mph 15 secs
attributes.background: It is common to see young drivers driving badly, too fast, aggressively,  and involved in accidents that cause death and injury to themselves and others. I believe it would be a relatively easy step to restrict the power and speed of cars driven by young drivers.
attributes.additional_details: It would require car manufacturers to create a new range of restricted, but affordable cars, that would also lead to cheaper insurance for first time drivers.
